questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in a Middle Eastern city is known for its sail-shaped silhouette and was opened in 1999 as one of the tallest hotels in the world?
questions.context: Often referred to as the world's only '7-star' hotel, this iconic structure stands on an artificial island and is a symbol of luxury.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in South America is an ancient Incan city located on a mountain ridge, also dubbed the Lost City of the Incas?
questions.context: Believed to be a royal estate or sacred religious site, it remained largely unknown to the outside world until being rediscovered in 1911.

questions.question: Which historic battle site in Europe was the location of a decisive conflict in 1066 that significantly influenced the English monarchy?

answer.label: Battle of Hastings Site, Battle, England

questions.context: The Normans' victory here led by William the Conqueror marked the beginning of Norman rule in England.

questions.question: Which famous museum in Europe houses the Mona Lisa and was originally a fortress built in 1190?
questions.context: This museum is the world's most visited art museum and a historic monument in France.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Europe, located in a city that was buried in volcanic ash in 79 AD, provides a snapshot of Roman life frozen in time?
questions.context: This site was rediscovered in the 18th century with remarkably well-preserved art and structures following the catastrophic eruption of Mount Vesuvius.
